alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 11 at 1:35PM PST until March 15 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Winter Storm Warning extended through Wednesday to include impacts from the next storm Tuesday into Wednesday. * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations through Monday: 4 to 12 inches at lake level and in Truckee. Mountain areas seeing 1 to 2 feet, with 2 to 4 feet above 7000 feet. Accumulations Tuesday and Wednesday: 4 to 12 inches at lake level and Truckee, with 1 to 3 feet above 7000 feet. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times. Snow loading on structures will increase due to the additional rain and snow being absorbed into the deep snowpack, along with higher risks for dangerous roofalanches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will vary between 6000 to 6500 feet through Monday, then rise between 7500 to 8000 feet Tuesday afternoon before falling below 6000 feet Wednesday morning. The heaviest snowfall rates are expected on Tuesday.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
